sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Hoboken to Schenker, dated January 3, 1926
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Sends New Year greetings; reports that he is to see in the Paris Conservatory Library the autograph manuscript of Beethoven's Appassionata Sonata, which Einstein has apparently already photographed; he will travel to Vienna on January 6 for lesson on January 9.

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten letter from van Hoboken to Schenker, dated January 3, 1926

tei:transcription.tei:p: [printed letterhead:] CENTRAL HOTEL 40 RUE DU LOUVRE PARIS [coat of arms] Teleph |Gutenberg 46-80 Louvre 26-08 Adr, Telegr^que^ CENTRHOTEL Reg de Comm^ce^ S^ne^ N^o^ 35157
Zu allererst erlaube ich mir, Ihnen und Ihre Frau Gemahlin ein recht gutes neues Jahr zu wünschen wobei auch meine Frau hier anschliesst.

Hier habe ich sofort Schritte unternommen um zur Autograph von Op. 57 Beethoven, Piano Sonata in F minor (“Appassionata”), Op. 57. The autograph manuscript was acquired by the Paris Conservatoire in 1889, and is now at the Bibliothèque Nationale. A facsimile of it was published in 1927, and reissued in 1970. zu gelangen. Ich erhielt von einem Freunde eine Einführung an Henri Prunières, Click on Henri Prunières. der Herausgeber der Revue Musicale und durch Letzteren kam ich zum Herrn Expert, Click on Henry Expert. der Bibliothekar (glaube ich) vom Conservatorium. The Paris Conservatoire de Musique. Dorthin gehe ich nun {2} am Montag und wird er mir dort das MS des Appasionata Beethoven, Piano Sonata in F minor (“Appassionata”), Op. 57. The autograph manuscript was acquired by the Paris Conservatoire in 1889, and is now at the Bibliothèque Nationale. A facsimile of it was published in 1927, and reissued in 1970. [sic] zeigen und noch viele andere Autographen. So soll dort ein Autograph von Chopin’s F. dur Ballade Chopin, Ballade No. 2, in F major/A minor, Op. 38. sein welches in verschiedenen Punkten wesentlich abweicht von der Version welche wir von dieser Ballade kennen.

Um nun Op. 57 Beethoven, Piano Sonata in F minor (“Appassionata”), Op. 57. The autograph manuscript was acquired by the Paris Conservatoire in 1889, and is now at the Bibliothèque Nationale. A facsimile of it was published in 1927, and reissued in 1970. fotographieren zu lassen so wäre nichts einfacher als das, da auch Herr Expert Click on Henry Expert. ein warmer Befürworter hiervon ist, da, wie er richtig bemerkte, die Manuscripte so leicht durch Feuer zerstört werden können und man dann gar nichts mehr hätte wenn sie nicht fotografiert worden sind. Doch meint er, dass das Autograph bereits aufgenommen worden ist im Auftrag von Dr. Einstein, Click on Alfred Einstein. München, welcher auch das ganze Autograph von Don Juan Mozart, opera, Don Giovanni, K527. hat fotografieren lassen. –

Ich habe meinen Platz im Schlafwagen für Mittwoch abend genommen. Demnach werde ich Donnerstag abend in Wien eintreffen und Samstag zur gewohnten Stunde Wednesday was January 6, and Saturday January 9: Hoboken’s first lesson for January is recorded in Schenker’s lessonbook 1925/26 as having taken place on Thursday January 14. mich bei Ihnen einfinden.
Mit bestem Gruss Ihr ergebener [signed:] AvHoboken

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten letter from van Hoboken to Schenker, dated January 3, 1926

tei:translation.tei:p: [printed letterhead:] CENTRAL HOTEL 40 RUE DU LOUVRE PARIS [coat of arms] Teleph |Gutenberg 46-80 Louvre 26-08 Adr, Telegr^que^ CENTRHOTEL Reg de Comm^ce^ S^ne^ N^o^ 35157
Allow me first of all to wish you and your wife a really good New Year, a wish in which my wife joins me.

Here I immediately took steps toward getting access to the autograph of Op. 57. From a friend I obtained an introduction to Henri Prunières, the editor of the Revue musicale, and through him I reached Mr. Expert, the librarian (I believe) of the Conservatory. I am going there {2} on Monday and he will there show me the manuscript of the Appassionata| and many other autograhs as well. For example, an autograph of Chopin’s Ballade in F Major is said to be there, which differs significantly in various points from the version we know of this Ballade.

Nothing would be easier than to have Op. 57 photographed, since Mr. Expert is an ardent advocate of this, for, as he rightly commented, the manuscripts can so easily be destroyed by fire, and then we would have nothing left had they not been photographed. But he believes that the autograph has already been photographed per order of Dr. Einstein, Munich, who also had the whole autograph of Don Giovanni| photographed. —
I have reserved my place in the sleeping car for Wednesday. Thus I shall arrive Thursday evening in Vienna and join you on Saturday at the usual time.
With warmest greeting, Yours sincerely, [signed:] A. v. Hoboken
